TaskDescription: Online prefrontal TMS-EEG experiment. Single pulse TEPs (120% RMT) - 100 trials

CoilDiameter.Description: Diameter of the outer winding of the coil.

MagneticFieldPeak.Description: Peak magnetic field at the surface of the coil.

MagneticFieldPenetrationDepth.Description: Depth at which the electric field reaches 70 V/m under the center of the coil.

MagneticFieldGradient.Description: Magnetic field gradient at 20 mm below the coil center.

coil_id.Description: Coil identifier. Should be described in Hardware part in json sidecar.

targeting_method.Description: Control method for the coil.(manual, fixed, cobot, robot)

Levels.manual: Coil is held and directed by the operator manually
Levels.fixed: Coil is fixed in place using a mechanical arm or holder (non-controllable)
Levels.cobot: Coil is positioned via a collaborative system (e.g., Localite arm)
Levels.robot: Coil is dynamically positioned via a robotic system

tms_stim_mode.Description: Type of stimulus(e.g. single, twin, burst, etc). Depends on Stimulator options.

current_direction.Description: Direction of induced current (e.g. normal, reverse).

protocol_name.Description: (when using sequence stimulation) The sequence timing mode unique name. (e.g. sici,lici,custom, etc)

waveform.Description: Shape of the TMS pulse (e.g. monophasic, biphasic, etc).

inter_stimulus_interval.Description: (ISI)  Time from start of first to start of second pulse (twin or dual).

inter_pulse_interval.Description: IPI - The duration between the beginning of the first pulse to the beginning of the second pulse (Interval between pulses in train in sequence mode).

burst_pulses_number.Description: Number of pulses in a burst

burst_duration.Description: Duration of a single burst block

pulse_rate.Description: (Optional) the number of pulses per second (pps or Hz)

train_pulses.Description: The number of pulses in each train.

repetition_rate.Description: The repetition rate refers to the number of repetitions per second (pps) at which the pulses are generated. Hz equivalent

inter_repetition_interval.Description: The duration between the beginning of the first burst to the beginning of the second burst. T=1/f

train_duration.Description: The duration of the train stimulation

train_number.Description: The number of trains in sequence

inter_train_interval.Description: The time interval between two trains is described as the time period between the last pulse in the first train to the first pulse in the next train.

inter_train_interval_delay.Description: Additional individual time delay that can be added to the InterTrainInterval for each Train in custom protocols

train_ramp_up.Description: The Ramp Up function allows programming a gradual increase in amplitude with each train during burst stimulation.

train_ramp_up_number.Description: The number of trains applied for Ramp Up function

ramp_up_duration.Description: (Optional) Time (in seconds) over which the stimulation amplitude is gradually increased at the start of a stimulation block or train.

ramp_down_duration.Description: (Optional) Time (in seconds) for decreasing stimulation amplitude at the end of a stimulation block or train.

stimulation_duration.Description: Total duration of the stimulation block

stim_id.Description: Unique identifier of stimulation target point. Follow the _markers.tsv

marker_name.Description: (Optional) Name of the cortical target, anatomical label, or stimulation site (M1_hand, DLPFC, etc.)

stim_count.Description: Count of pulses determines the stepping and number of pulses produced per mark.

pulse_intensity.Description: An expression for the power output level as a percentage of maximum stimulator power

second_pulse_intensity.Description: Actual for Dual_mode. The independent power output level of the second pulse as a percentage of maximum stimulator power.

pulse_intensity_ratio.Description: Actual for Twin_mode. Ratio of the power output levels of two pulses B/A.

rmt_intensity.Description: Resting motor threshold as a percentage of maximum stimulator output

amt_intensity.Description: Active motor threshold as a percentage of maximum stimulator output

pulse_intensity_rmt.Description: Stimulation intensity for the first or single pulse as a percentage of the Resting Motor Threshold (% of RMT).

second_pulse_intensity_rmt.Description: Stimulation intensity for the second or single pulseas a percentage of the Resting Motor Threshold (% of RMT).

pulse_intensity_amt.Description: Intensity of first/single pulse as % of AMT.

second_pulse_intensity_amt.Description: Stimulation intensity for the second or single pulseas a percentage of the Active Motor Threshold (% of AMT).

stim_validation.Description: Validation of the applied stimulation. Whether stimulation was validated

current_gradient.Description: Actual measured value of the coil current gradient.

electric_field_target.Description: Electric field at the target point

electric_field_max.Description: Peak electric field generated by the coil

response_channel_name.Description: Channel name used for the response (motor-response) measurement.

response_channel_type.Description: Type of channel used for response measurement. The channel types are similar to the list of eeg modality channel type.

response_channel_description.Description: Brief free-text description of the channel

response_channel_reference.Description: Name of the reference electrode(s). This column is not needed when it is common to all channels. In that case the reference electrode(s) can be specified in *_eeg.json as EEGReference).

status.Description: Data quality observed on the channel. A channel is considered bad if its data quality is compromised by excessive noise.

status_description.Description: Freeform text description of noise or artifact affecting data quality on the channel.

intended_for.Description: (Optional) Path to the recorded file refers to. BIDS-style path. (example: `bids::sub-01/eeg/sub-01_eeg.eeg`)

timestamp.Description: Timestamp of the stimulation event in ISO 8601 format
